assessments.question: Understand the specific business objectives that the managed services project aims to achieve.
Identify and document detailed business requirements for each application.
Create an inventory of all the applications that will be covered under the managed services project.
Assess the criticality and strategic importance of each application within the portfolio.

section: Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Service Level Objectives (SLOs)

assessments.question: Define clear SLAs and SLOs for each application, outlining performance, availability, and response time expectations.
Ensure that SLAs align with business requirements and are achievable.
Analyze the architecture of each application, including components, interfaces, and dependencies.
Document integration points and interdependencies between applications.
Determine the scalability needs of each application to accommodate growth in users and data volume.
Define performance requirements and benchmarks to ensure optimal application performance.
Assess the security measures and compliance requirements for each application, including data protection, access controls, and regulatory compliance.
Identify any vulnerabilities and risks that need to be addressed.
Develop data management strategies, including data storage, retention policies, and data backup procedures.
Establish backup and recovery strategies to ensure data integrity and availability.
Evaluate the existing infrastructure supporting the applications.
Assess the technology stack, including servers, databases, middleware, and network components.
Review existing vendor relationships and contracts related to software licenses, hardware maintenance, and third-party services.
Assess vendor performance and identify opportunities for optimization.

Establish a governance framework for managing the applications, including change management, incident response, and service continuity planning. - Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulations, and best practices.
Estimate the staffing requirements for managing and supporting the applications. - Allocate resources based on workload and criticality.

Develop a detailed cost estimation that includes operational costs, personnel expenses, hardware and software licensing, and any additional investments. - Create a budget that aligns with the project's financial constraints.
Identify potential risks associated with application management and establish mitigation strategies. - Develop a contingency plan for handling unexpected challenges.
Implement monitoring tools and procedures to proactively identify and address issues. - Define performance management strategies to ensure applications meet SLAs.
Plan for training and knowledge transfer to ensure the team is equipped to manage and support the applications effectively. - Document best practices and procedures.
Establish a reporting framework to provide stakeholders with regular updates on service performance and compliance. - Define communication channels and escalation procedures for incident reporting.

Implement processes for continuous improvement, including regular reviews, performance evaluations, and feedback loops. - Adjust the managed services strategy based on lessons learned and changing business needs.
